Referenced by ajax_comments_shutdown().

00073                                     {
00074   status_header(200); // HTTP/1.0 200 OK
00075   // QUIRK: Normally we would return 200 to indicate success or 500 to indicate error. However,
00076   //        Opera 9.x will discard the contents of XMLHttpRequest.responseText unless it receives 200.
00077   //        Fortunately, jQuery.ajax will also recognize errors if the responseText does not match the specified jQuery.ajax.dataType.
00078   //        Therefore successions are passed in JSON and errors passed in plain text.
00079   @header('Content-Type: text/x-json; charset=utf-8', TRUE); // set content type to JSON
00080   die($output); // output to browser and die
00081 }

00027                                                     {
00028   global $ajax_comments_errors;
00029 
00030   // Catch non-errors (e.g. blank, redirect only)
00031   if (trim($buffer) == '') {
00032     return FALSE; // pass-through
00033   } else
00034 
00035   // Catch wp_die() WordPress Errors
00036   if (strpos($buffer, 'WordPress &rsaquo; Error') // if an error is present
00037       && preg_match('!<p>(.+?)</p>!is', $buffer, $errors)) { // parse it out
00038     $ajax_comments_errors[] = $errors[1]; // return plain-text error only
00039   } else
00040 
00041   // Catch unexpected WordPress Errors (e.g. custom plugin errors)
00042   if (trim($buffer) != '') {
00043     $ajax_comments_errors[] = ajax_comments_innertext($buffer);
00044   }
00045 
00046   return ''; // catch/filter everything
00047 }
